newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania police seize hashish in Moscow-bound train.
newsitem.headline: Romania police seize hashish in Moscow-bound train.

text.p: Romanian police said on Monday they had seized 4,500 kg (9,900 lbs) of hashish hidden in a freight train bound for Moscow.
A police dog found the drugs in two containers laden with furniture heading, via Hungary, to a private company in Moscow, said a statement issued by police in Bihor county on the border with Hungary.
In 1993, police in the Black Sea port of Constanta seized 11 tonnes of hashish and cannabis aboard a ship bound for the Netherlands.
